messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
When did Lovecraft withdraw from high school?
You are a helpful assistant.
Why did Lovecraft never return to school?
He was two and a half years short of graduation
You are a helpful assistant.
How did Lovecraft support himself financially?
On the dwindling family fortune and by what little he could earn as a ghostwriter and revisionist
You are a helpful assistant.
What was Lovecraft's family relationship to him?
His
You are a helpful assistant.
How did Lovecraft view money in his life?
As the detached, amateur aristocrat
You are a helpful assistant.
Why didn't Lovecraft return to school after graduating?
two and a half years short of graduation
You are a helpful assistant.
How did Lovecraft initially receive feedback on his writing?
unqualified success
You are a helpful assistant.
What happened to Lovecraft's fortunes after Farnsworth Wright became the editor of Weird Tales?
HPL more often met with rejection than success
You are a helpful assistant.
What was the result of Lovecraft's attempts to publish his stories under Farnsworth Wright's editorial demands?
only partially successful
You are a helpful assistant.
Why did Lovecraft initially refuse to submit his stories?
Crushed by the repeated rejections
You are a helpful assistant.
Why was 'Dreams in the Witch House' published?
It was secretly submitted by a friend (August Derleth) to Wright.
You are a helpful assistant.
What was Lovecraft doing during the time of repeated rejections?
He was doing professionally published revision work, including ghostwriting.
You are a helpful assistant.
How much of Hazel Heald's 'The Horror in the Museum' was written by Lovecraft?
90% or more of it was the product of HPL.
You are a helpful assistant.
What was the outcome for Lovecraft's work under his own name?
It continued to be rejected.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who provided root ideas for Lovecraft's stories, such as 'The Curse of Yig'?
Authors such as Zealia Bishop and Hazel Heald.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who wrote most of the stories 'The Curse of Yig' and 'The Horror in the Museum'?
HPL (Howard Phillips Lovecraft)
You are a helpful assistant.
Why was Lovecraft's work under his own name rejected?
He never achieved more than semi-regular publication in the pulp magazines of the day.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who was the target audience for Lovecraft's work?
A small core of avid fans—many of them writers themselves.
You are a helpful assistant.
How much of Lovecraft's stories were actually written by others?
90% or more
You are a helpful assistant.
Which author published Lovecraft's work in amateur magazines and later in 'Weird Tales'?
Other authors of the macabre tale, and later in 'Weird Tales'
You are a helpful assistant.
Why was Lovecraft's work rejected under his own name?
Lovecraft’s work under his own name was rejected.
You are a helpful assistant.
What type of publications did Lovecraft achieve semi-regular publication in?
pulp magazines of the day
You are a helpful assistant.
Who did Lovecraft ghostwrite the story 'Under the Pyramids' for?
Harry Houdini
You are a helpful assistant.
Where did Lovecraft initially come into contact with other authors of the macabre tale?
Weird Tales
You are a helpful assistant.
Who were some of the authors Lovecraft regularly corresponded with?
Robert E. Howard, Clark Ashton Smith, and Robert Bloch
